description: A system of Romano-British enclosures between the Cotswold escarpment and Robinswood Hill. At least one of these enclosures has been interpreted as a polygonal wayside shrine.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Portway (Gloucestershire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Rawes. “The Romano-British Site on the Portway, near Gloucester.” Trans Bristol and Gloucestershire Archaeological Society 102 (1984).
